title: Nathan Mason
text:
Nathan Mason (born 8 September 1993) is an English <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a for the <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield Giants</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Super%20League">Betfred Super League</a>.
He previously played for the <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield Giants</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>, and on loan from <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a> at <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Oldham%20R.L.F.C.%20players">Heritage № 1325</a>) in the <a href="2017%20RFL%20Championship">Championship</a> and <a href="League%201%20%28rugby%20league%29">League 1</a>, and the <a href="Batley%20Bulldogs">Batley Bulldogs</a> and <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh</a> in the <a href="RFL%20Championship">Championship</a>. Mason also played for the <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> in the Super League, and spent time on loan from the <a href="London%20Broncos">Broncos</a> at the <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Championship">second tier</a>.
Background.
Mason was born in <a href="Oldham">Oldham</a>, <a href="Greater%20Manchester%2C%20England">Greater Manchester, England</a>.
Career.
In October 2017 he joined the <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh Centurions</a> on a one-year loan deal.
In 2019 he helped the Eagles to win the inaugural <a href="RFL%201895%20Cup">1895 Cup</a> as they defeated the <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes Vikings</a> 36–18 in the final.
